page.title: 04POPULATION AROUND NENTHEAD
page.content: In 1861 when mining was at its peak 2039 people lived in our block.Using the Electoral Roll and School Registers etc. we estimate the present population to be 392.The decline in population has followed the decline in the mining industry though in the last 10 years there has been a slight increase.It seems that some people with young children have recently moved from cities to Nenthead in search of a quieter life-style.The relatively cheaper prices of property could also have attracted them here. The majority of retired people have lived in Nenthead all their lives as few people choose to retire here. The harsh climate,lack of job opportunities,increased travel costs to work,unattractive derilect houses, mining property and spoil heaps are all contributing factors to depop.
